All of City of DeSoto, Texas

  • Place One - Mayor

Place One - Mayor

  • Residents may request the mayor's presence for various events, such as opening ceremonies, ribbon cuttings, and dedications.
  • You may complete a request form by clicking HERE .
  • Request a Ceremonial item by clicking HERE (Proclamation,
    Special Recognition, etc.)

  • Learn more about Mayor Rachel Proctor: Explore her leadership vision and contributions to the DeSoto community.

  • Discover her journey: Click HERE to read Mayor Proctors's full biography, including her personal and professional milestones.


  • Schedule a meeting with Mayor Proctor: Interested in discussing city matters directly with the Mayor?

  • Meet with a Councilmember: Click HERE to request a meeting with either the Mayor or a Councilmember by filling out our request form


  • Get in touch with the City of DeSoto: Have questions or need
    assistance?

  • Contact us today: Call us at 972.230.9645 for more information or support.


  • Mayor's Internship Program: A great opportunity for
    students to gain hands-on experience in city government.
  • Learn more: Click HERE for additional details and application information about the Mayor's Internship Program
  • DeSoto Community and Champion Award: Honoring residents who have made exceptional contributions to improve and positively impact the local community.
  • Learn more: Click HERE for more information on the award and how to nominate someone deserving.

  • Mayor's Quarterly 360 Meeting: A forum for Homeowners’ Association representatives and citizens to discuss community issues and upcoming projects with the Mayor.
  • Stay informed: Click HERE to learn more about these important meetings and how to participate.
  • Faith Leaders' Quarterly Meeting: Bringing together faith leaders, educators, and community members to foster collaboration and dialogue for community improvement.
  • Get involved: Click HERE for more information on these meetings and how you can participate.
Mayor's Stake Holder's Meeting
  • More information coming soon!!

  • DeSoto COAD: A group of independent organizations offering support through donations, volunteers, and emotional or financial aid during disasters or emergencies.
  • Learn more: Click HERE for additional information on how DeSoto COAD assists residents and how you can get involved.
